review_data.content: everything done to the highest standard with the best ingredients and service. presentation is also beautiful and the restaurant decor is very soothing. highly recommende
Nos hospedamos no hotel e nosso café da manhã era no Pavillon. O restaurante é lindo e a variedade do café da manhã enorme. Adoramos

Con amici a Zurigo veniamo a cena in questo ristorante stellato che ben conosciamo.Anche stavolta si confermano le impressioni delle altre.Un maitre gentile e simpatico ci accoglie giovialmente, del resto praticamente siamo diventati amici.La atmosfera è, come sempre, ovattata.Scegliamo il menu di assaggio di sette portate Harmonie.Tutto molto raffinato con una nota di merito per i carabinero.Poichè il ristorante ha riaperto solo la sera prima ci sono dei meccanismi che ancora devono essere oleati, voglio dire che c'è stato qualche inciampo nel servizio ma tutto ampiamente perdonabile dalla bontà della cucina.

Ich war mit meiner Frau im Pavillon und wir bestellten das kompeltte Menu inkl. Weinbegleitung. Fazit: Fake! Für uns war alles etwas fake. Die Bedienung war nett, aber nicht herzlich und mit Freude dabei. Die Mienen waren aufgesetzt und das Lächeln künstlich: Also fake! Das Essen war gut, aber mehr Schein als Sein. Optisch hochwertig, geschmacklich eher langweilig und eintönig. Die geschmackliche würzige Raffinesse fehlte komplett. Das sollte in einem 2 Stern Restaurant Standard sein: Fake! Und die anderen Gäste: Vorwiegend alte Geschäftsmänner mit 20 jährigen Escorts. Zum Teil echt unangenehm, wenn am Tisch neben dir ein 65 jähriger mit einer 20 jährigen knutscht. Und du merkst noch, dass sie es nur fürs Geld tut. Nicht, dass es extrem schlimm wäre, aber es passt zum Gesamteindruck und zu diesem Laden: FAKE!

Been to many Michelin star restaurants and this was one of the better ones. Everything was great even at that standard. Maybe one or two courses were not as great as they could be, but this is really subtle. Highly recommended. We went for the normal 9 course menu. We appreciate both the taste and presentation a lot, and the wine pairings were also spot on.

Wir gönnten uns eine Übernachtung im Baur au Lac (für uns übrigens mit Abstand das beste Hotel in der Stadt) kombiniert mit einem 9-gängigen Dinner im Pavillon. Dies war unser erster Besuch in diesem Restaurant. Die Gerichte kamen farblich jeweils schön komponiert auf den Tisch und waren durchaus einfallsreich in ihren Kreationen. Leider kam der Geschmack nicht bei allen sehr gut rüber, speziell bei den Vorspeisen. Die einzelnen Gänge wurden sehr rasch hintereinander aufgetischt und überhaupt machte das in grosser Zahl anwesende Personal über den ganzen Abend einen eher gestressten, hektischen und unsicheren Eindruck. Dies darf in einem solchen Haus nicht sein. Und wenn somit bei einem derart hohen Menu-Preis nicht alles stimmt, kommt schlussendlich etwas Enttäuschung auf. Speziell auch, wenn ich an vergleichbare Lokale denken, welche wir im vergangenen Jahr noch besucht hatten, wie z.B. The Restaurant im Dolder, das Cheval Blanc in Basel, Ann Sophie Pic in Lausanne oder das Memories in Bad Ragaz. Wir werden jederzeit wieder gerne im Baur au Lac übernachten, aber beim Pavillon belassen wir es bei diesem einen Mal.

What a great meal! We ordered the 7 course meal with wine. Each dish was a dream on its own. The wines were very good but for the first 3 dishes which melted on your tongue, I found the wine too strong. The staff friendly and knowledgable. A really great meal

C'est un très joli restaurant à côté du lac de Zurich!L'accueil est très chaleureux! L'ambiance est intimiste, le lieu est exceptionnel, parce que les fenêtres sont grandes. La cuisine est délicieuse et classique. J'ai mangé le plat les pâtes à la crème et à la truffe, je me suis envolée de ma chaise.Le restaurant est cher, mais il en vaut vraiment la peine!

Abbiamo cenato in 2 adulti e 2 bambini per il mio compleanno dei 40 anni. La location è molto bella, lussuosa ma non esageratamente. Personale cordiale. Il servizio è stato buono, qualche piccola pecca c’è stata come portare l’amuse Bouche in contemporanea mentre stava servendo il vino che dovevo ancora assaggiare, visto le 2 stelle Michelin e i 18 punti sono più pignolo nella recensione. Comunque nulla di grave. Noi abbiamo mangiato 2 menu potager (7-9 portate) i bambini uno i chicken nuggets, 1 lo sminuzzato alla zurighese entrambi molto buoni. Il nostro menù era ben presentato e molto buono ed abbondante, l’unica critica la faccio alla tartlette di arancia sanguinella l’abbiamo trovata troppo pesante per essere un pre dessert, non sapeva tanto di arancia e rimaneva l’amaro dell’arancia secca. Piccola sorpresa ben gradita per me con l’arrivo del dessert finale .Abbiamo bevuto un ottimo Pinot noir dei donatsch, fantastico A parte questo comunque ci tornerei sicuramente e lo consiglio. I prezzi sono in linea
Restaurant elegant et vraiment relaxant avec vue sur la verdure pour vous détendreHaute cuisine .. Le filet mignon etait super !!Service excellentTrès belle carte des vins

The hotel Baur au Lac is a Zurich institution and its upscale restaurant Pavillon is a very elegant place to enjoy exquisite French cuisine. When we visited, we had the pleasure to enjoy several exceptional dishes, such as carabinero with curry or turbot with morels. However, some of the courses did not entirely convince me in terms of texture, taste, or quality. All in all, the dishes were a bit too heavy. Also, service was very formal and attentive, but not always on the expected level, e.g. pouring the wrong wine in a half-full glass, not explaining anything about the dish they served, variing in waiting times between courses from only a few minutes to more than three-quarters of an hour. To sum up, this is definitely a very good place for an elegant night out, but it can not provide the perfect dining experience you might expect from one of the most prestigious places in Zurich.

Wunderschönes Restaurant (Garten und Seeblick) mit bester Küche im Zentrum Zürichs;sehr angenehmer, sehr ruhiger und diskreter - aber doch sehr aufmerksamer Service.Wenn die Bauerei neben dem Kanal einmal vorbei sein sollte ist dies eine wahre Oase imHerzen Zürichs!

On 15th August 2019 me and my daughter took lunch in Pavilion...The menu was fairy- true proof that the high gourmet food is an author's masterpiece, very delicious masterpiece - delicious gourmet.Our compliments are also for the staff and especially for Patricia and her colleague , for sadly we don't know his name but he was talking to us in Italian language , I think this can help to the managers to understand who I'm talking about.They both made us feel very cozy, in same time feel very special too...We saw incredible professionalism and human finesse in both of them two.We can't wait to be there back...

If you want to impress someone with a luxurious dinner in one of the most prestigious restaurants in town, it probably has to be the Pavillon at the Hotel Baur au Lac. Exquisite food served in a very elegant atmosphere with top service. Do not ask about the prices; they are very high and you must be prepared to accept them graciously while spending an extraordinary time.
Très bel endroit où nous avons pris nos petits déjeuners. Service excellent, en plus du buffet, vous avez la carte.
Wonderful place, we love it , service , taste everthing is amazing. We will come again . Thanks for everyrhing

Im schön gestalteten Pavillon darf in entspannter Atmosphäre sehr diniert werden. Hier kann man erleben und bewundern, wie Küche, Service und Sommelier auf höchstem Niveau die Gäste verzauben. Meine Frau und ich sind begeistert! Jeder Gang war ein geschmackliches Ereignis und die Weinbegleitung war schlicht und einfach perfekt zum Essen abgestimmt. Wer hier noch nie war, hat wahrlich etwas verpasst. Wir sind entschlossen, wieder zurück zu kommen. Tausend Dank an das gesamte Team, welche Gästen so eine Freude zubereitet!

E' sempre una festa tornare a cena in questo raffinato ristorante.L'accoglienza è calorosa, il maitre è sempre sorridente a dispetto di certi luoghi comuni sulla freddezza elvetica.Cinque tipi di pane freschissimo.Sommelier pluridecorato nonostante la giovane età.Il menu viene rinnovato con una sempre migliore attenzione per le sfumature.Scegliamo le nove portate senza preoccuparci di chiedere in cosa consistono tanto sappiamo che tutto sarà eccellente.Così in un susseguirsi di piatti che sono una festa per gli occhi ma soprattutto per il palato abbiamo la conferma della bontà della nostra scelta. Il conto naturalmente è adeguato ai livelli elevati del ristorante.Lo Chef Laurent Eperon merita le due stelle.

Over the top discreet attentive service by formally dressed waitstaff of whom each table seemed to have five or more. Incredible local food and a winelist to die for. Elegance and formalism out of a movie, and yet none were upset by our "pack light for Europe" clothing which did NOT include a jacket or tie. At first I felt out of place, but the staff made us feel welcome.Only go here to make an evening of it with folks you want to talk and linger with. Also, be prepared to spend more than you have ever spent for dinner. For those with the means, or who want a special treat, this is the place.

We treated ourselves to a Michelin star restaurant during our Rhine river vacation. We ordered the 7 course and the 9 course dinner. The 9 course would have been too much for me but my husband didn't feel overly full with the 9 course. The food was VERY rich but absolutely delicious

We have enjoyed two splendid meals at this lovely restaurant on successive trips to Zurich, spaced 3 months apart.The food quality was high, the flexibility to cope with odd quirks was impressive, the service was friendly, excellent and knowledgeable - and the atmosphere was relaxed - despite the setting of a top Zurich hotel.We look forward to our next visit.

Great ambiance - you can certainly feel the exclusivity of the place the moment you walk in. Make sure to dress up as your ripped jeans and classic shirt may not necessarily fit in this place. Service is great, I wouldn't call it "very memorable" though. Food is fantastic, except, for a 2 michelin stars and 18 gault millau, I was expecting an extremely "wow experience", which, I regret to say, I didn't quite achieve (or perhaps, I am just very picky). I thought the selection of the dishes from their tasting menu isn't as special as the other michelin starred restaurants I've been in the past. Don't get me wrong, still very tasty foods! If you want to experience such place and don't want to pay the super expensive price (Swiss level expensive), then Pavillon is a good start.

Our final meal after 3 months traveling throughout Europe, and probably the best dinner we had. The small appetizers were delicious and the range and quality of dishes for all courses was nothing short of superb. The wine list was excellent. Highly reommended.

After dining at many other Michelin starred restaurants in the world, Pavillon is one of my favorite in terms of food, ambiance and value. When I was deciding between the 4 2-Michelin starred restaurant in Zurich I decided on Pavillon because their menu (and of course their interior) on their website interested me the most. The food turned out to be wonderful. We chose the 9-course Harmonie tasting menu and I loved every single dish. The carabinero in red curry was my favorite. I honestly wanted to lick my plate. Even the sweetbread was absolutely delicious. I normally don’t eat sweetbread! Great service as well. The experience is worth every penny. Thank you for a wonderful evening I will visit again!
Wonderful service and stunning venue. I loved everything about my meal. My husband had to send back his fillet because it was not rare, but they immediately made him another one.

My husband and I had one of the most unforgettable culinary experiences of our LIVES at Baur au Lac's Au Pavillon! The Chef is incredibly talented and the menu changes regularly. Truly a delectable variety of traditional Swiss fare, the Swiss veal is not to be missed, with the most beautiful cheese cart we have ever seen to follow for desert. Wine pairing is definitely recommended, we were in heaven!

Incredible meal at Pavillon! We had the 7 course testing menu. First class service, fabulous food and wine pairings!1. Some caviar and more caviar2. Prawns with the most luxurious sauce with a hint of coconut and lemongrass3. Sweetbreads and some other stuff. Yummy!4. Venison and a yummy sauce and this almond thing that went so well with it5. Foie gras with venison tartar and a yummy foam. This was seriously good.6. A "pre-dessert"7. And the real dessert, a strawberry rhubarb thing that was sweet and tart.

From the time you pull up to the marvelous hotel that houses this gem you know the evening will be like no other. Impeccable service and food that is unlike any other. The tasting menu is one of the best I have eaten and I have had tastings from all over the world at some of the best. The two Michelin stars are well deserved. Portion size is perfect and even after 9 courses there was no feeling of being “stuffed”. The chocolate at the end is a fitting finish to this delectable feast. The unique Swiss wine pairing is a must as Switzerland only exports 1 percent of its wine and getting to try so many was marvelous. Make the journey to Zurich and make sure you come to Pavillon.
The food was rich and enjoyable without killing you. But it was the attention to service that made the experience worth mentioning.

This two Michelin star restaurant is located in the famous Bau Au Lac hotel. Upon arrival, the entrance to the restaurant impresses, with the chic contemporary decor. Tables are well spaced out and offers a lot of privacy.I took the degustation menu which is 7 courses and add a Sea Bass main course. The highlight of the meal is definitely the carabinero prawn. Never had I tasted a prawn that's as good as lobster if not better. The rest of the dishes were great too and the Sea Bass was very delicious. Everything was very fresh and cooked with a lot of care and attention. The presentation of the dishes was artistic and impressive. Thankfully, despite taking the tasting menu, the portions were at least of reasonable size.The ambience of the restaurant is great and the service is very attentive. Although I felt that after spending CHF300/= on a meal, the departure farewell could have been better after I was presented with the bill.All in all, a fantastic but pricey meal for a restaurant that does lives up to it's reputation. One does pay a lot to dine here but in return, you get quality and that's the minimum expectation befitting a two Michelin star restaurant. If you are keen to splurge, I highly recommend the Pavillon. I don't think you will be disappointed. 4 out of 5 rating.

Leider für 2 sterne die erwartung war grosserUnd für 853 fr viel zu teuer für 1 Carabinero der alt war 1 Langustine die in supe schwimnt...Turbot mit andere supe nebenbei Boeuf und Veau gulaschEnttäuschend

Wie andere schon geschrieben haben, besteht die Gefahr, dass bei so hohen Erwartungen Enttäuschungen möglich sind. Nicht so im Pavillion.Hier wird Gastronomie auf höchstem Niveau zelebriert. Angefangen beim freundlichen Empfang, über den aufmerksamen Service von A-Z und natürlich die Gerichte. Ein Fest für Auge und Gaumen. Hier stimmt wirklich jedes Detail und wir haben den Abend bis zum letzten Moment sehr genossen.

Wir hatten einen Tisch mit Aussicht auf den Park mit schönen alten Bäumen, und etwas weiter auf den See.Die Bedienung war unaufdringlich aber sehr aufmerksam. Das Menu 'Harmonie' war insgesamt wie der Name verspricht, sehr harmonisch - einige Speisen beinhalteten ein eigentlliches Geschmacksfeuerwerk. Nur die Zitronenvariationen in einer der Nachspeisen war etwas weniger perfekt - ein Element war schlicht zu sauer. .
Delicious dinner, nice and professional staff, beautiful place. Wonderful experience. It lovely to fo first to the garden (in spring/summer) and then to the Pavillion restaurant.

My wife and I both tried the seven course tasting menu. It was wonderful. Just an amazing experience. The service was of course excellent but also warm and welcoming. There was no stuffiness or over formality. The food was some of the best I have ever had the pleasure of tasting. Each course was better than the one before. You must try this restaurant

The restaurant premises are spectacularly beautiful and refined. There were beautiful flower arrangements. The breads were fresh but not of three star quality. The amuse, except for the last one were ok. The last one was creative, beautiful and delicious. The asparagus appetizer was good while the salmon was the best I have ever had. A good restaurant, will probably make it to three stars some day.

There are 2 parts to this review: food and atmosphere.The atmosphere part is mixed. The setting is beautiful and refined as you would expect it to be. However, the restaurant makes very little effort in asking the guests to adhere to a basic dress code. Personally I dislike it when you have groups of people sitting in torn jeans, dirty sneakers and T-shirt’s, it diminishes my experience. Additionally, that evening there were kids shouting and running around which is something I have quite frankly never seen in an establishment of this category. As such, atmosphere is overall mixed, leaning towards lacking.Food is ultimately why you visit such a place and we had high hopes. The start (kitchen’s appetizer) was quite frankly not becoming of a starred restaurant: 2 small puff pastries with a bit of creamy fillings. I’m quite partial here but over the years I have seen what can be done and this wasn’t even on the spectrum.The first part of the tasting menu was rather unspectacular. The first three in particular were served partially frozen. While this was partially done by design (according to the chef) which is fair, I thought that it was too much so and robbed some of the taste.The fourth dish was the last that stood out negatively from my perspective: the caviar was set on the warm ravioli in the kitchen which resulted in it being warm and slightly soggy by the time it reached the table. It really should be served directly at the table in order to avoid this.From the fifth course on it got better and better. Not every single element was to my liking but this was largely due to personal taste rather than culinary execution. The veal juice in particular was excellent, a truly rich taste without the burned undertones, something that I find difficult to achieve. The cheese tray as well as the desert were excellent and worthy of the establishment.Last but not least, the wine pairing was quite pleasant and adapted to the dishes. The sommelier was competent and knew his trade well, which always factors in well for the overall impression.All in all a neutral-positive experience. It was nice and we’ll keep positive memories of it but there is room for improvement, especially when competing with similarly priced/decorated dining places in Zurich. We would recommend it if you don’t want to leave the city center and still eat well.

Enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the Pavilion, took the a la carte menu which was made to perfection and had a surprising twist that made it into a memorable meal.It was our first time there, but we will definitely return.

Wir hatten aufgrund der Reputation des Pavillons hohe Erwartungen. Die Gefahr war demnach gross, enttäuscht zu werden. Das ist hier nicht passiert. Im Gegenteil: Unsere Erwartungen wurden z.T. noch übertroffen. Vom freundlichen Empfang, über ein aufmerksames Service-Team, einen sympathischen Sommelier und ein ausgezeichnetes Essen - es war einfach von A bis Z alles SUPER!Wir sind eigentlich Vegetarier und haben an diesem Abend bewusst auf unsere Prinzipien verzichtet und haben es nicht bereut. Trotzdem die Frage: Gibt es auch ein vegetarisches Angebot im Pavillon?Vielen herzlichen Dank an das ganze Pavillon-Team!

Knapp 100 Franken mögen viel Geld für einen Lunch sein. Doch für das Gebotenen ist es ein fairer Preis, der Gast erhält mehr als 3 Gänge. Zwei Grüsse aus der Küche werden zuerst serviert. Anschliessend gibt es französische Küche vom Feinsten, alles serviert in bester Qualität, gekocht auf allerhöchstem Niveau, kunstvoll angerichtet. Der Service hat entsprechende Klasse, die Weinkarte Ist hervorragend, man besitzt ja eine eigene Kellerei. Wir freuen uns schon auf unseren nächsten Besuch !!

Wundervoller Tisch, Ideenreiches 9-Gang-Menü begleitet von traumhaften Schweizer Weinen (sehr informativ vom Sommelier-Weltmeister erklärt - nochmals merci), sehr aufmerksamer und professioneller Service.Auch merci an die Restaurantleitung fuer den Hinweis an den Nachbartisch, das telefonieren zu lassen. Einfach sehr professionell
We celebrated my wife birthday- Wonderful restaurant. , impeccable service A wonderful experience Highly recommended

Von A - Z ein wunderbarer Abend, dank dem ausgezeichneten Service der Mitarbeiter im Pavillon und dank den vorzüglichen kulinarischen Erlebnisse, welche das Harmonie Menü (9-Gänger) zu bieten hatte. Unbedingt wieder ein Besuch wert!!
#Excellent 🥰👌foods . Special mention to Martin (Service), sehr aufmerksam, sehr freundlich 👏👍 top service & merci vielmals an Torsten Marmé ebenfalls...❤️❣️
Einfach nur wow! Was hier geboten wird ist ganz grosses Kino!Service und Essen in Perfektion - PUNKT.

餐廳位於蘇黎世碼頭附近，由蘇黎世火車站步行約10-15分鐘便可到達。 不論是環境還是服務都是米芝蓮餐廳的水平。侍應們非常細心介紹每道菜亦很用心地留意和滿足客人們的需要。食物方面，最欣賞這裡的自家製麵包及甜點，這是我在瑞士食過最美味的。反而前菜及主菜只達到較平常好的水平，但不值米芝蓮2星，例如我點的主菜是煎鱸魚，魚皮並沒有煎到脆皮的，而且還有一根魚骨，這些都是不應該出現在米芝蓮2星餐廳的。總括來說，食物的味道是中上的，而且環境和服務都是非常好，我還是會推薦朋友來這裡用餐。
Freundliche, aufmerksame Bedienung. Super schöne Einrichtung, Hauptgang hat mich geschmacklich jedoch nicht so beeindruckt. Vorspeise und Dessert war sehr gut. Schönes Ambiente, guter Ausblick.

I had the pleasure to go recently for dinner at Pavillon (after having lunch there last summer) and I have to say it fully deserves the 2 Michelin stars rating.Overall the atmosphere of the room, the quality of service and the carefully selected wine list makes it a truly memorable experience.We had the 8 courses tasting menu (around black truffle) and we truly enjoyed each course (the carbonara ravioli might have been just a little too salty for our taste – but on the other hand we did not mention upfront that we prefer lightly salted dishes).Same as during my previous visit, the service was very professional and with a great attention to details. Truly a place to recommend in Zürich.

Maintaining its well-deserved reputation as a classic and legendary venue within Zurich, Head Chef Laurent Eperon never fails to impress guests with his striking 21st century interpretations of classic dishes. Located in the Baur au Lac Hotel, this restaurant was designed by famous architect Pierre-Yves Rochon, boasts a glass gazebo with an imposing 16-foot high rotunda and roaring 1920s chandeliers, which can be seen from the park outside. Since its refurbishment Pavillon now welcomes diners all year round for lunch and dinner.

Here you are extremely well taken care of arriving by your own car or just dropped off. perfect service, excellent food and a noise level enabling you to actually have a cross table conversation with your guests. The view is outstanding.Reservation needed.

Schneller Businesslunch war gewünscht... Lauer Empfang vom jungen Mann aus Griechenland... Essen war für dies Preissegment gut...Servicetechnisch mit Sicherheit Luft nach oben!Ein wenig überbewertet für dieses Ranking auf Tripadvisor!
Нам очень понравился ланч в этом чудесном ресторане, все было очень изысканно и вкусно. Чудесно декорированный обеденный зал, замечательное обслуживание! Большое спасибо!
We stayed at the Baur au lac and this was were you would have breakfast in the morning. It was outstanding!

After our Kronenhalle disaster the night before, the Zurich food scene redeemed itself with a terrific meal at Pavillon. It's price-y but worth it. We found the maitre'd and waitstaff super friendly and accommodating. The room is gorgeous - an Art Deco vision in purple. Excellent bouillabaisse starter and superb Swiss veal Zurichoise in mushroom cream sauce. Delicious mocktails. The soufflé was good though had a cold spot in the center. The only slight misstep in an otherwise wonderful evening.

The Menu Harmonie in this restaurant is nothing short of brilliant. Each sublime course that was presented was even better than the one before, which actually didn't seem possible. Having eaten in restaurants with 3 Michelin stars I am baffled to why this lovely property was awarded only one. I would highly recommend it to anyone without hesitation.

After living in the Zurich area for 11 years we finally made it to the wonderful Pavillon restaurant at the Baur au Lac Hotel. It was simply perfect. As is my habit, I won't go into details about the menu because I believe a talented chef deserves for his/her dishes to be discovered and celebrated without preconceived notions. We chose a la carte instead of the tasting menu because that is typically our preference. We prefer to more of a few dishes than a little of a lot. We loved absolutely everything. We each chose a fish starter followed by a heavy game dish. This could typically pose a challenge for a sommelier in terms of wine pairing. Not here! Our young, friendly and extremely knowledge sommelier chose perfect glasses of white for our starters and an impeccable red for our main course. Additionally, the entire team is without fault, all superstars in service, warmth and conversation. The team is perfectly intuitive without being intrusive. We look forward to returning, soon and often!
J'ai été conquis par le cadre de ce restaurant, par le professionnalisme des serveurs et par la qualité des plats proposés. Je recommande ce restaurant en dépit des prix élevés.

I was there first time . Wonderful place with excellent menu and very courtesy and professional staff.It's more like a place in somewhere south France )I can't pass everything, just visit, feel atmosphere, enjoy the meal and leave your review )

Le Pavillon, in una cornice raffinata ma non spocchiosa, propone piatti raffinati proposti e presentati da un maitre e da camerieri che hanno una sincronia e un tempismo perfetti. Interessante la cantina.

An ideal place for a party of 2-4 wanting to concentrate on themselves and be well attended to. The large windows onto the hotel park combined with opulent floral arrangements create a very pleasant setting. Service is impeccable. The food is very good but perhaps here and there at the pricelevel we‘re at the last touch is not totally perfect, more a 4/5 than a 5/5. Overall, when leaving, one is always very happy though. Try to get a table in the round pavillion part.
Das Ambiente ist gediegen wird mit einem Blick auf den schönen Garten ergänzt, das Personal ist zuvorkommend und das Essen ein Genuss. Hier wird Essen noch zelebriert.
Ambiente agradabilissimo, principalmente nas mesas espalhadas pelo jardim. Opções do cardapio mais leve, porém sofisticado. Atendimento muito bom.

We had the lunch menu and it was really really good. We were able to change several courses from the set menu and everything was excellent.The restaurant is very elegantly decorated with several huge flower bouquets.The staff is amazingly nice and helpful - very professional.10 out of 10.
The food is good, but the service is terrible, definitely doesn’t suit an expensive restaurant. It left me with bad taste. I will .never go there again

The ambience and design of the restaurant is just gorgeous, I love flowers and the bright colors, well lighted area.We had lunch in Pavillon a la carte .Crab salad with caviar starter was good, but a bit over salted, I love crab and caviar, but it was not some very special mix of tastes, another starter of raw fish was great, just pesto might be a bit to harsh for it.We both had sea-bass as the main dish, the fish was very very well cooked and interesting garnish beside, however, I think it could’ve been done better and the truffle was very outraged and did not contribute to the taste of the dish as much as it could, therefore, a bit disappointing.We had a nice bottle of wine and the service was very attentive and pleasant, they all spoke many languages and were very educated. I recommend to try it, but it wasn’t some place where you are running to get back.

W e were six people one woman I wanted something special for our board meeting ! I am glad we did not sit outside in the garden as there are a lot of wasp.The Menu was 76 Fr. Two entrances to choose from Vichysoise and Carpaccio with truffles and a cheese I do not remember. I prefer the classical carpaccio but the meat was exellent the truffels did not smell of anything. Second courseSt. Pierre with a sauce, this was my choice the sauce was exellent, the bean salad very strange. My husband and my son in law had austrian "Reh" the meat was very tender and exellent. The desert, an english Patissier "Tiramisû" This is a classical desert It should remain classical nobody should invent something new or do not name in Tiramisû !! Pleasant service a little bit too "indisrêt" but we will be back I like the setting and the peace !

In der Mitte vom Pavillon steht ein fantastischer Blumenstrauss der umwerfend aussieht, nicht nur die Grösse beeindruckt sondern die Farben perfekt abgestimmt, auch die Gestecke auf den Tischen sind klein aber fein. Das Menue war hervorragend und verdient Bestnote! Auch die Aufmerksamkeit zum Geburtstag hat uns alle sehr gefreut - nochmals vielen Dank ! Grosses Lob auch dem Personal vom Empfang bis zur Verabschiedung sehr aufmerksam und sympathisch! Es war ein toller Abend und wir kommen gerne wieder.

Started with cocktails in the very nice outdoor bar area, then sat by a window in the beautiful round main room with a gorgeous central flower arrangement. We were a party of 4 for dinner.....2 chose the 10 course w wine pairing, 2 chose alacarte items with a bottle of wine- always very nice to have the options. The champagne recommendation was excellent, as were the wines. All the food was excellent, but I must say the service/sommelier experience may have been the best ever anywhere. Given the mixed dining option logistics, the service in general was efficient, attentive, and smooth. Both the manager Aurelian and sommelier Mark were so knowledgeable, professional, accommodating, pleasant, personable- they truly differentiated the evening from other top fine dining experiences. We could not enjoyed the evening more.

Wenn man an einem Montag Mittag Geburtstag feiern möchte, hat man in Zürich keine grosse Auswahl. Wir haben uns dann auf Grund des Gault Millau für dieses Restaurant entschieden. Es war ein Erlebnis! Herzlicher Service, unübliche Bestelloptionen und das Gebotene war umwerfend kreativ und überraschend. Kulinarisch steht es dem Bündner Kollegen Caminada in nichts nach. Das Ambiente ist jedoch eher dem Zürcher Geldadel geschuldet. Klassische Luxushotellerie, aber ohne angestaubt zu wirken. Vielleicht etwas bieder, was dem kulinarischen Angebot nicht ganz entspricht. Aber hier sollte nicht das Haar in der Suppe gesucht werden. Wir wurden glücklich und kommen wieder.

Wir wurden sehr freundlich in Empfang genommen und durften ein sehr feines Nachtessen einnehmen. Burger und Grillspezialitäten waren ausgezeichnet. Ich selber habe ein vorzügliches Gericht mit Ziegenkäse und ein kleines Früchtedessert

Zu zweit waren wir zum Lunch im Pavillon. Man sitzt perfekt an nicht zu eng platzierten Tischen. Der Service war tadellos, äusserst zuvorkommend und angenehm professionell. Das Menü von hervorragender Qualität und toll präsentiert. Wer die Vorzüge einer Sterneküche liebt, ist hier wunderbar auch über Mittag aufgehoben.Man bekommt das Gefühl, ein willkommener Gast zu sein, das ist toll.
Comemoramos o aniversário do meu marido nesse restaurante e foi excelente. A comida e o atendimento é um espetáculo. E o local é muito lindo. Apesar de caro, eu recomendo, pois é um excelente lugar.

This is by far the best restaurant in Zurich we have tried (we live here). It’s expensive but we felt like we got excellent value for money. The quality of the food and preparation was truly outstanding and the service was both highly professional and warm and pleasant. Plus there’s the central location and very nice garden.It was an uplifting and impressive experience to eat here and we’ll be back!
You will get an enjoyable evening with high-class service and delicious meals. As always the waiters are taking care of your well-being and your wishes.

Die Bedienung ist erstklassig, ,der Speisesaal auch, aber die Qualität des Hauptganges kann nicht mithalten. Das Preis / Leistungsverhältnis stimmt nicht.Die Küche kann nichts dafür, aber der Lieferant des Fleisches. Das Cote de Boeuf für 4 Personen war zäh !

Ich war mit meiner Frau im Pavillon Abendessen. Ich muss wirklich sagen es von A-Z ein perfekter Abend. Es fing an mit einer sehr herzigen und sympathischen Begrüßung auch unser Kellner aus Griechenland war ein absoluter Fachmann er war nicht nur sehr kompetent sondern auch höflich und zuvorkommend. Das Essen war sein Preis absolut wert und wurde durch die super Weinbegleitung noch mehr aufgewertet. Vielen Dank für den tollen Abend wir kommen definitiv wieder.

Zurich est réputée pour être une ville relativement chère et je ne dirai pas le contraire.Néanmoins, certaines choses sont évaluées à leur juste valeur et tel est le cas dans ce magnifique restaurant.Tout y est raffinement, professionnalisme et attention (tant en cuisine qu'au service).La décoration est de très bon goût, sobre et élégante et les bouquets de fleurs fraîches apportent une explosion de couleur et de fraîcheur.Le personnel s'adapte à la clientèle en faisant l'effort de parler l'anglais, le français, l'allemand... sans contrainte et au besoin.Les produits sont d'une fraîcheur remarquable et les associations de saveurs judicieuses voire étonnantes.Alors effectivement le prix bien élevé peut freiner mais c'est un savoir-faire et une prestation de grande qualité qui y sont proposés.
Alles super von A-ZKomme wiederTolle KücheTop ServiceTop LageEinfach herrlich hier essen zu können.

A small group of us visited the restaurant early this week. It is situated within the Bauer Au Lac hotel. What an experience from start to finish, pre drinks I’m the hotel bar was excellent then we walked through the eloquent and wonderful restaurant. A fantastic setting and a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere. We were lucky that the Christmas decorations were up and the Pavilion and the grounds ( including a giant ginger bread cake) looked truly fantastic. The level of Service was truly first class and we received excellent help and assistance on our choice of food and drink. The menu and wine list were both extensive. One of my friends had a local dish looked and smelled fantastic. Another friend and I shared the duck was was carved at our table and was delicious. We wanted fine dining and something very speacial ,all on which was delivered. Well done and thank you all

Loved the breakfast here during my recent stay. They offered the perfect balance between a healthy start of the day, and with the bonus of a few sweets to remind you that you're on vacation. Lunch and dinner were executed perfectly, and the portion size was just right. Next time I hope to return during summer so I can experience dining outdoors and take advantage of the beautiful garden.

Остановились в отеле «Baur au Lac”, который конечно же заслуживает отдельной похвалы.. вечером решили поужинать в ресторане при отеле.. это было просто восхитительно! Лёгкий крем-суп из петрушки в качестве комплимента, к тому же мы попали на начало сезона белого трюфеля, в качестве основного блюда взяли утку на двоих, остались в полном восторге и от еды, и от обслуживания. Рекомендую!!
Délicatesse Art food!I went there with a friend and we both enjoyed the very fine food as well as the outstanding service.Highly recommended!

Wir hatten das 9-Gang-Menü (CHF 205) mit 6 internationalen Weinen (CHF 90) passend zum Menü. Das Essen war exzellent und die Weine haben sehr gut dazu gepasst. Die Erklärungen des jungen Sommeliers waren professionel.Wir waren das letzte Mal vor einigen Jahren bei Laurent Eperon. Er hat sich wirklich nochmals verbessert und seine Küche und auch der Servcie verdienen die 18 Gault Millau Punkte wirklich.

Wir wählten das 9-Gang-Menü (Menü Harmonie) mit der internationalen Weinbegleitung aus. Die Amuse Bouches und Vorspeisen waren ein Traum, und sogar die Hauptspeise (Rindsfilet)- bei solchen Menüs oft eine Schwachstelle - war ausgezeichnet. Den Ziegenkäse liessen wir durch den Käsewagen ersetzen und das Lebkuchen-Dessert durch das Dessert "Schokolade" aus der regulären Desser-Karte. Auch die Weine waren hervorragend und harmonierten gut mit den Speisen. Am besten schmeckte uns der Chardonnay "Silhouette" von Merryvale aus dem Napa Valley. Sehr gut war auch der Service und die Wartezeiten zwischen den Gängen waren nicht zu gross.

Been to a couple of Michelin star restaurants, and this one is going to be one of my favorites. Because the food is without too much upschmuck, it’s understandable and fine. But.... if you are a wine lover, this is really the place to be! Wow, so many great wines to choose from.I took an a la carte dinner, crab first and then veal. Veal is absolutely tender, loved it. Then cheese as desert, also brought me joyful tastes. But my wine was the best. CH 160 for the bottle Vosne Romanee but this is really a bottle I don’t see very regularly. And yes, it was worth while every euro.Besides that, the service of the friendly people makes it in my opinion, a big 10 out of 10.

We came w another couple for an anniversary dinner. The dining area was lovely and the service was good. The tasting menu was quite excellent, worthy of its high Zurich price. However the dessert was a bit off, not that creative for a one Michelin star restaurant and a bit too sweet. A la cart prices are outrageously high, a simple small portion main dish would cost you on average 100 CHF. It is a very good one by Zurich standard.

We came here for a special lunch and took a tasting menu. It is a beautiful restaurant with exquisite decor and nice atmosphere. But in my opinion, it is not living up to its Michelin star restaurants, at least in comparison to others that I visited. The service was so-so. Food good, but not extraordinary. There was an interesting dining crowd, a mixture of business lunches, hereditory rich meeting their relatives for lunch, and exotic designers couple. Overall, an interesting experience, but I would not recommend it further.

We came here to surprise a friend for her birthday celebrations. The food was amazing (my friend said it was like a dream!) and the restaurant surprisingly busy for a Monday evening, which is itself indicative of the quality. My friends had the tasting menu and I ordered a la carte since the items on the tasting menu didn't appeal to me. The items were always a constant surprise with originality and combination of flavours. The staff were excellent - very helpful, acted promptly to get the bill when my friend had momentarily excused herself, proactive in offering to take a photograph for us. It was a wonderful evening.
Très bon restaurantle personnel est au petit soin et parle plusieurs languesles produits sont frais d'une grande qualitésCher mais c'est la Suisse
Sitting outside in the warm evening with good friendsGood drinks. Great little meal before. Off to another eventThe staff here is delightful. Breath in deep it does not get any better

Had the 9 course tasting menu. Food and service were fabulous, and this restaurant absolutely deserves its Michelin One Star status, and in truth, I found it on par and/or superior to several 2 stars I've visited. Plan to budget about 200 CHF per person, and that's without wine.

I booked dinner for 5 for my 30th birthday and could not have made a better choice. We got the 9-course Menu Harmonie with Swiss wine pairings. A couple of us had dietary restrictions and the staff acknowledged this and offered excellent alternatives with a smile. I was offered a pretty little cushioned stand for my bag, and the team at Pavillon made me a nice surprise for my birthday.I love the purple accents and I noticed the drinks and food complemented the decor with their colours, although this may be unintentional - I'm just really into colours. I also really appreciated that the atmosphere was unpretentious and we could relax and laugh and just enjoy great food and ask many questions if we had them, without feeling like we'd asked too much :)I had been wary of booking somewhere completely new, not wanting to risk being disappointed. I left feeling like I couldn't have chosen better. Thank you, thank you, thank you for a memorable evening none of us will ever forget!

Went to Pavillon for a romantic dinner. The service was outstanding. Wine list extensive, we followed the sommelier recommendation. Menu was complete and diversified with top quality ingredients.I had mango homemade ice cream for dessert, simple yet delicious.Pricey but worth every dollar!

Visited Pavillon for our anniversary dinner and had a fantastic time. The very friendly and attentive staff did its best to make us feel welcome and at home.We opted for the small tasting menu which was excellent (7courses). Since we didn't want too much wine we opted for champagne by the glass where we got a very good recommendation.All in all a successful evening and amongst several, so far clearly the best Michelin-awarded restaurant in Zurich we have been to. Great price-performance on a very high level!

Wir waren zu dritt im Restaurant Pavillon welches zum Hotel Baur au Lac gehört.Entschieden hatten wir uns bereits im Voraus für das Degustations Menu.Das Restaurant ist sehr nett in Weiss und Flieder gehalten, dass Personal war sehr nett und durchaus witzig.Die Speisen sind frisch, nicht zu verspielt, die Portionen für ein Degu Menu waren überraschend gross.Mit 400.- (inkl Internationale Weinreise und Trinkgeld) ist es im Vergleich mit dem Dolder, Atlantis und dem Trio Roy in Basel an der Oberen Grenze preislich

It is a very impressive place to go. The service is impeccable. The food is marvelous. The environment is unforgettable. It is a good place to go for celebrating for different events. If you love food, you must choose here. We are very appreciated about the service. When we checked out, the weather turned bad in heavy pouring with thunders and lightnings. We parked our car two blocks away, and we didn't have an umbrella. When we didn't know what to do, unexpectedly, the manager came out and brought us an umbrella. He is such a caring person to his customers.

Von der trendigen Rive Gauche Terrasse ging es direkt in das gut besuchte „Le Pavillon“: Architektur im Teller, das 7 - Gang Menu begeisterte. Es fehlt nicht mehr viel für einen weiteren Stern. Vielleicht lag es an der Kombination beim Dessert, die zu einfache Präsentation beim Hauptgericht? Auf jeden Fall lag es nicht am einwandfreien Service. Wir werden auf jeden Fall nochmals kommen und uns überraschen lassen.

The ingredients are good but badly used. The menu is limited and has excessive and uncoordinated performance by servers: basically, butter arrives without the bread, drinks are not delivered conjoined, and it is more about acting than about results. Pretentious without merits.The main server acts more like a boss inside a business office than as a collaborator to helping you with your choice.

I admit I had come here once prior but did not fully enjoy. The customer service post evening was great a nice man Mr. Bellucci insisted to invite my parents husband and I to come back and try.We were seated at a beautiful table, Aurelien took care of us and the entire experience changed. It was perhaps my best dining experience in Zurich. The food is excellent and his touch just made the whole evening very pleasant. I often go back for high tea in their foyer but this is the place to go for a nice dinner when you want more than just exquisite food.I have a special occasion coming up for my mother and I cannot think of anywhere else to take her than here that is worthy! I also realized I had never reviewed the place (i am not too active here) but this one was too fantastic not to share with all the users.The restaurant even made us a soufflé on demand for her because she loves them.We had the menu harmonie each dish was wonderful. I am surprised this is not better rated here. I would even say I do not want to try a few new fine dining places in zurich because I was so pleased here.Only food for thought for restaurant (personal preference): perhaps sometimes use less deep bowls.Else impeccable. Chapeau bad to Aurelien, Stefano, the chef and all the staff that created such a wonderful experience that evening. Thank you. Zurich simply doesn't have enough of this.
L'endroit est magnifique et le personnel très agréable et qualifié. de la pure restauration comme elle se fait rare. Le sens de l'accueil était vraiment à la hauteur de la cuisine de haut niveau.

What can I say? This is one of those restaurants that you won't forget. From the impecable service to the wine and every single course, were perfect in every way. The ambiance is classic but not stuffy and the view is beautiful. It is located in the hotel Baur au Lac.Great location, very close to the main shopping street, Bahnhofstrasse. Great sommelier: Blanc

We had the privilege of visiting the Pavillion on a spring Friday evening dinner. To our tasting, this restaurant offers a 360 experience with superb quality, which is clearly reflected by all means: from the beautiful decor, through the friendly, warm and professional service given by the team, to the utmost important detail of all: the kitchen.Each dish has been served with perfect plating design, along a harmonious explanation and a swiss smile. It's been pure pleasure to have gone through a colorful journey that lasted a few good hours of indulgence.Cannot wait for our next visit to Zurich, when we will absolutely return to the Pavillion.PS - Do not miss the story of the hotel's history, including anecdotes on a few very important guests such as R. Wagner, Walt Disney and Nobel. Inspiring.

Ресторан находится на берегу Цюрихского озера и обладает звездой Мишлен. Мы выбрали меню из 7 блюд с подборкой швейцарского вина.В меню из 9 блюд дополнительно находится блюдо с фуагрой и блюдо с овечьим сыром.Редкое сочетание вкуса, нормальных порций и удивительно подобранного швейцарского вина. Что входит в меню (примерно):- Тунец блюфин в роскошном соусе с местным Пиногрджо- Белая рыба с анчоусами, оливками и т.п. с роскошным Шардоне (даже купили с собой 3 бутылки. Это Шардоне из маленькой винодельни и отель (в котором и находится ресторан) скупает его все и продает через он-лайн магазин и через магазин в отеле. Стоит около 33 франков, но обладает удивительным сладким ароматом луговых, медовых цветов)- Мус из ягод для перехода к мясу и красному вину- Стейк из швейцарского ангуса и к нему картофельное пюре с копченым угрем (изумительно!!!) и роскошным местными пино-нуар- Ягодный сорбет с шоколадным мусом- Фантастический десерт с карамелизированным фенхелем, жаренным имбирем с великолепным десертным вином на подобие айсвайн.
We had a wonderful meal here. The dining room is beautifully and very luxuriously decorated - with a view on all sides of their lovely garden. The food is expensive - but delicious.

This is one of my all time favorite restaurants decor-wise simply because there was so much purple all over the place (my favorite color)! My seat had a gorgeous view of the garden (which also had quite a bit of purple) - Baur au lac is such a beautiful hotel right by the lake. I came here for lunch on a weekday. There weren't very many people - just a few Bahnhofstrasse bankers here and there chatting quietly amongst themselves, so it was very relaxing and peaceful. They have a 3 course special for 98 CHF, which honestly sounds quite reasonable to me for a Michelin meal in Zurich where everything in general is quite expensive. The food was great and the staff was extremely friendly. I was feeling a bit ill that day, so decided against having any alcohol, but I do wish I got to try some of the wine. Oh well...I guess that means I'll have to come back!

Very nice restaurant in Baur au Lac. Very good food, attentive and nice waiters. But the prices were too high. Compared to international prices the price for main course was 50% higher than a top London restaurant for example.

We were travelling and dining all over the world in a nice Michelin Restaurants and were very much exciting to have today our new gastronomic discovery in Pavilion. We really enjoyed the food and atmosphere of a restaurant, but there are certain things that we would love to mention...In any industry there is a big gap in "promise" and "deliver of the promise" and when somebody is over-promising and under-delivering it is a bit sad and pity...especially nowadays when service is everything and when you have high expectation for the "whole package" of “exceeding your expectations” while going for dining in one of the best hotel in Zurich.Our lunch today had a great history behind – it was a birthday surprise for my husband and I wanted so much everything to be perfect. I ordered and prepaid what I considered to be the best option for such event – 9 course menu with the selection of International wines. But unfortunately my expectations were a bit dragged down…I felt like being in a fast food dining restaurant and not in restaurant of one of the best hotels in the city. Food and wine were served without any “soul”. Sommelier was just reading what was written on the bottle and sometimes explaining the basic taste features, but there was no any history behind wine…and it could have made the whole experience much more colorful…after all wine deserved to be talked about and if you love wine you cant keep its story for yourself…isn’t it?Dishes itself were represented very “dry” and simple without any background…I don’t think that Chef Laurent Eperon who definitely created his food with love and passion and on a very high level would be happy to know that the way how his great food was introduced to the customer was not different from the “simple” restaurant in the old city or that some of it was even forgotten to be described, like it happened with amuse boushe..We don’t want to create a feeling that we know better how to make things, we would love to just raise some concerns of how promising and delivering expectations can differ. The gap can be slightly thin and almost invisible or huge…and for us today the gap today was large. One additional thing made this gap even larger. It is when we were asked to pay for a water and Rose Champagne at the end of the lunch. That was rather surprising, considering that lunch was prepaid and staff new that it was a present...Since we were not informed in the beginning that it was not included in a prepaid menu I was surprised to get a bill at the end.Anyway, we enjoyed our time in Pavilion and sweet birthday surprise was a very nice touch. We really hope that our feedback would help staff to bring restaurant up to a better service level, because when you love the place you work in, you want the best for it, isn’t it?
A very interesting menu including a Chef's multi course option for lunch. Service is great, as is the food.

Le service est vraiment d une grande qualité . Tout le personnel fait l effort de parler dans votre langue (dans mon cas le français) et est au petit soin du début à la fin.La carte des vins est très fournie et recherchée.S ouvre à soit la possibilité d un diner en 9 plats ou bien tout simplement La carte.Le homard termidor est une merveille.Le seul bémol est le pain. En effet dans un restaurant de ce standing on peut s attendre à se voir servir un pain de l équivalent d un meilleur ouvrier de France et ce n est pas le cas.Malgré tout, l accueil et les mets sont d une grande qualité et ce restaurant est très grandement recommandable.

Unsere kleine Feier zu zweit war schlicht perfekt. Das 7-Gang Menü hat uns begeistert wobei der Wolfsbarsch das Highlight war. Der Service aufmerksam, kompetent und äusserst freundlich. Geschmackvolles, gediegenes Ambiente.Ein gelungener Abend. Mein Kompliment an Küche und Service-Team.Im Vergleich zu unserem Besuch vor 2 Jahren wurden unsere Erwartungen noch übertroffen.

We had a surprisingly unusual (not to say unpleasant) experience yesterday at the restaurant Pavillon.We ordered two 9-course-meals but we were very surprised that not all the courses were served to us. The cheese plates were missing.. After we received and paid the bill, we had to ask to the waiter if there was a cheese plate included in the menu and he had to check with his supervisor. The supervisor laughed and asked us if we were "still hungry after the 8 courses we enjoyed". The only suggestion proposed by this surpervisor was to propose us to be served the said cheese plates after having desserts and sweets (and paid the bill) while we were about to leave.. This is very unprofessional and does not correspond to the quality of services you would expect at Baur au Lac nor does it correspond to what we paid..

Ristorante come si dice "di lusso" quindi c'è da aspettarsi che sia tutto o quasi perfetto. Il menù lunch di per sè sulla carta sembrava promettente, poi mi è arrivata una insalatina di verdurine crude con una cremina tipo zuppetta fredda che bisognava mangiare chiaramente col cucchiaio anche se sul tavolo non se ne vedeva l'ombra, ho dovuto ordinarlo. La sogliola poi si era indurita dalla troppa cottura. Migliori a mio avviso la zuppa di lenticchie verdi e le guancie di vitello brasate. Fra l'altro per un menù di 76.- franchi (un antipasto e un piatto principale senza dessert!) mi sarei aspettato delle porzioni leggermente più abbondanti, ma si tratta pur sempre di un ristorante che per lo stesso prezzo la sera offre a malapena una sola portata.

A Pavillon is a detached house and 'detached' describes the experience pretty well.The experience started with the wonderful Baur Au Lac staff welcoming us and taking care of our car while Matthias Köhler guided us to the restaurant next to Schanzengraben, the quaint moat built in the 1880s.After a tour de force of three amuse-bouches we were easily persuaded to go for the tasting menu and didn't regret it. Head Chef Laurent Eperon has been awarded 18 points and the title "fastest climber" by Gault&Millau in 2017 and deserves his Michelin-Star. His cuisine is classic yet fresh and light compared to some other gourmet temples.But to me the stars of the evening were the people in the service who are doing a Phantastin job to make you feel right at home in the airy rotunda designed by Pierre-Yves Rochon.We have had a wonderful evening and highly recommend dinner at Pavillon.

Laurent Eperon and his team leave nothing to want. His Menu Harmonie was a great culinary journey complete with seasonal truffles and decadent after meal sweats. It is no wonder that he has been recognized as 'Up-And-Coming Chef Of The Year 2017' by GaultMillau.

This is one of the most exclusive restaurants in Zürich, with no suprise it is located at one of the top hotels in Zürich, Baur au Lac. Unless you have a printing press for money, I advise with caution. But if you are celebrating or worthy of some serious self-indulgence, then you have come to the right place to eat like a king in a Michelin star setting. Everything is literally perfect from start to finish! The service is sublime yet always there to care for you. Two glasses of Dom Perignon to kick off the dinner and you are already out CHF 100! After the wine, appetizers, steaks and dessert.. A bill of over CHF 1000 for two people was the price to pay.. but each bite was a treasure of memories, and the atmosphere a once in a lifetime experience.

Excellent, attentive and personalized Service. We felt very well taken care of. The cuisine was exquisite, we had the truffle menu which was delicious with amazing quality produce! Every member of staff approached us with a smile, which created a warm and friendly atmosphere. The space is well decorated and comfortable. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone, who is looking for an exceptional food and service experience in Zurich! We will definitly go back soon!

Wir besuchten das Restaurant über Mittag. Es war gut besucht (reservieren lohnt sich). Beim Eintreten begrüsste uns der stellvertretende Küchenchef, danach führte uns der Gastgeber an einen wunderschönen Tisch. Charmant und diskret wurden Empfehlungen ausgesprochen. Was danach folgte war ein Fest für die Augen und für die Sinne. Hervorragendes Preis/Leistungsverhältnis. Grosses Kompliment an die Crew! Für mich die Nummer 1 in der Stadt und eines der besten Gourmet Restaurants der Schweiz! Probieren Sie es selbst aus.
Dieses 1 Star Michelin Restaurant ist im Hotel Baur au Lac und wegen der aussergewöhnliche Lage mittags vorallem geniesst man gutes Essen mit Licht.

Nice atmosphere. Good presentation and great service! We really enjoyed our dinner. Our 10 year old was offered a tailor made dish that she likes. My husband and I went with Chef's menu...I thought it is better than a Michelin 1 star.

Gediegenes Ambiente und eine exzellente Küche. Das Abendmenü war Spitzenklasse mit saisonalen Gaumenfreuden. Sehr abwechslungsreich und ausgezeichnet zubereitet. Die Weinbegleitung war absolut stimmig.Gerne wieder.

Der Raum - Le Pavillon - ist wunderbar und schön dekoriert. Und trotzdem will keine gute Ambiance aufkommen. Wirkt auf uns alles etwas steif. Soll das Absicht sein? Glaube ich kaum. Viel Service-Personal, trotzdem das Gefühl, einer von vielen Gästen zu sein: Höflich, aber "kein Draht" zu uns. Zu lange auf das Essen gewartet. Sicherlich alles schön dekoriert - trotzdem will ich auf meinem Teller kein Häutchen auf der Sauce sehen (zu lange unter dem Salamander gestanden).Die Preise sind zu hoch, viel zu hoch. Die Portiönchen zu klein.Ich kenne das Restaurant seit vielen Jahren. Mein Fazit für den heutigen Abend: definitiv ungenügend.

Im Dezember 2016 war ich geschäftlich zum Abendessen hier. Den Tisch für 6 Personen bestellte ich rund drei Wochen zuvor, die schriftliche Bestätigung incl. des aktuellen Menüs kam postwendend. Einen Tag vor dem Abendessen versicherte ich mich nochmals telefonisch positiv, dass alles in Ordnung sei und das Menü unverändert gelte. Am Abend des Anlasses erhielten wir in dem sehr eleganten Ambiente des Restaurants einen sehr schönen Tisch und der Abend versprach, nur das Beste. Nachdem der Aperitif v gereicht wurde, eröffnete uns der Restaurantleiter, dass der Hauptgang Rehrücken nicht verfügbar sei. Es gäbe zwar noch Stücke vom Reh, aber „das ist nicht die beste Qualität und die möchte ich Ihnen nicht anbieten“. Auf meinen verblüfften als auch verständnislosen Gesichtsausdruck hin, wurde eine Entenbrust offeriert. Um weitere Diskussionen insbesondere in Gegenwart meiner Gäste zu vermeiden, blieb nichts anderes übrig, als die Ente zu akzeptieren. In unserer Runde wurden die begleitenden Weine bis auf die ersten beiden ultraflachen Gewächse als unaufregend-passend empfunden. Der Service hätte stellenweise zügiger die beendeten Teller entfernen können. Dieses hochbewertete Restaurant in einem traditionsreichen Haus hat – leider auch in den Augen meiner Gäste – versagt. Der Küchenchef fühlte sich nicht verpflichtet, den Gästen gegenüberzutreten. Dies war der erste und letzte Besuch; 2000 Franken kann man in Zürich genussvoller ausgeben.

Fomos em razão da recente premiação com uma estrela Michelin! O atendimento é excelente! O meu prato estava muito bom ( peixe )! O preço, considerando um restaurante com estrela Michelin na Suíça e o nosso desvalorizado real, não tem como não ser caro!
Nice menu and wonderful service. Admittedly we arrived as the first guests, but the service was stellar and the Eggs Benedict were perfect.

Food was mediocre I cannot believe this to be a Michelin star. I have been to best restaurants with over 35 Michelin restaurants I have tried in my lifetime. It not all bad but too slow it took us 3 hrs to finish and we didn't eat dessert very well since it's almost midnight yet we were the first ones to arrived even before opening at dinner.
Etant pour le WE a l'hôtel Baur au lac nous avions réserve au PavillonParfaitAcceuil personnalise décors fabuleuxpersonnel sommelier cuisine tout impeccableVaut très largement le retour

Das Menü Harmonie war perfekt in Zusammenstellung und Zubereitung. Die einzelnen Zutaten waren von höchster Qualität und in einer überraschenden Weise kombiniert und verarbeitet. Die Weine passten hervorragend zu den einzelnen Gängen. Der zusätzliche Zwischengang bestehend aus einem Rührei mit weissem Trüffel war ein zusätzlicher Gaumenkitzel. Lediglich der erste Wein war zwar auch gut aber wie bei allen mir bekannten Schweizer Weinen merkte man die fehlende Sonne. Dafür waren alle Folgenden hervorragend. Als finales Highlight dann noch eine exquisite Käseauswahl und der Abend wird somit für immer in bester Erinnerung bleiben.Eigentlich überflüssig zu erwähnen, dass auch der Service der obersten gastronomischen Klasse entsprach.

Beste Bedienung, schönes Ambiente, Essen auf höchsten Niveau ohne unnötigen Firlefanz und bemühenden exotischen Kombinationen, dafür den Eigengeschmack der Zutaten aufs Beste hervorgehoben. Ein wunderschöner Abend!
The small and cozy restaurant in the hotel.Great service.All dishes are simply delicious.Venison simply melted in the mouth.Many thanks to the chef Laurent Eperon for his art.Great wine list

We came here for a meal early in the summer on one of my frequent business trips to the city. It's adjacent to the best hotel in Zurich so we decided to try it. The decor is lovely, the staff were friendly. However, they made some errors with the order that led to us returning dishes (ingredients I said I was allergic to were visibly present in the food). We were then charged for the said dishes and had to ask for the amount to be taken off the bill. It was ultimately fixed. However, I was not happy to have had to ask. I've seen the responses from the manager to negative feedback on TripAdvisor, so was very surprised no-one apologised to us at the time. Very disappointing. That being said, the food we could eat was tasty, if not slightly fussy.
We purchased breakfast with our room. It was a mistake. The service is terrible. The food is passable. DO NOT ORDER EGGS.

Ein wunderschöner Ort im eleganten zeitgemässen Stil, keineswegs angestaubt! Ein Idealer Platz für ein Geschäftsessen, die Tische stehen weit genug auseinander. Sehr gute eher leichte Küche. Der Service wirkt leicht abgehoben ist aber aufmerksam!

My husband and I went on Saturday night and had reserved a table in the garden for a pre-dinner cocktail. A great garden spot in the center of Zurich with fantastic service.We then chose to eat in the pavilion Restaraunt instead of dining in the garden bar. To be honest, I was a tad disappointed by my main meal (slow cooked veal) v v simple and boring and not particularly tasty. I had a lobster starter which was delicious. The dessert menu is exceptionally boring! Not one chocolate anything on the menu. After asking I did get a delicious moose. The service was v good but all in all we think in the summer dine outside with limited menu and save inside for the winter.

refinement, signature, high level of the presentation. One of the best dish: o sole mio.That is really the taste symphony.This restaurant can surely be the symbol, landmark and the signature of Zurich.Quality is the rule of this place I think.

We were a party of 5 celebrating an event. It was not a busy night. We had a set menu. The food was very good; and the ambiance was classy and enchanting. What ruined it was the terrible slow service and the confused staff. After many blunders they gave us the wrong bill and the manager had a very slow reaction to fix matters, with not even an apology! We officially complained and the administration was quite apologetic the next day calling my daughter offering a free dinner to compensate. We never wanted to go back and i am not sure whether she did give them another chance.

Beautiful fine dining Michelin star restaurant at its best! The dishes are carefully presented and the presentation alone is a work of art. Everything I tasted was out of this world. Amazing wine selection as well. I went with my females, one of the best evenings with tastefully crafted summer menu. The sommelier is very knowledgeable.Highly recommended for a romantic evening.

All is right with the world.... Pavilion Restaurant at the Baur au Lac Hotel, both true classical institutions in Zurich. In my opinion one of the best hotel / restaurant combinations in Switzerland.At first glance the selection on the food menu seems dwarfed and somewhat limited, especially in comparison to the immense wine list. But, you soon come to realise there's a reason Rolls Royce don't make 50 different models. Every dish is professionally crafted to the extreme.Sounds pretentious I know, but I'm still not sure how you can get so excited over 100ml of Gazpacho! But it's the fact it's infused with herbs and a frozen sorbet of Spanish tomatoes. I live in Spain about half of the year, so Gazpacho is a staple, but nowhere near the quality and thought that's put into this 100ml of cold soup! And that's what the entire establishment is all about, both the hotel and restaurant are perfectly honed to the nth degree.So, there's an entire restaurant review on 100ml of cold soup! But if they can get a page of review on that, you can just imagine the quality of the rest of the menu! Sublime!The perfect place to stay and eat in Zurich.

Lovely restaurant, recently renovated. Beautiful decor and flower arrangements. The food was excellent, wonderfully prepared. Service was fast, efficient and friendly making us feel very comfortable. Will definitely go back.

Had the veal for my entree at Pavillion and am obsessed with how it's cooked and the sauce that comes with, absolutely delightful. The service here is the best we experienced in Zurich and potentially all of Switzerland. The staff was timely, but not overbearing, and extremely friendly while still seeming genuine. Everything was prepared perfectly, we agreed one of our best meals during our vacation!!

We had a wonderful meal with the five course tasting menu with wine pairings. The pairings were perfect. Waitstaff was courteous and prompt. The restaurant environment is bright, elegant, peaceful and full of flowers. I am sure the menu changes regularly with the pairings so I won't comment on a particular food I will just say everything was prepared and presented beautifully.
cena d'affari in 6 cosa dire tutto impeccabile dal locale al personale alla carta dei vini complimenti alla cucina per i loro piatti creativi e gustosi

Myself and my girlfriend visited this restaurant last night and were really happy with the food and service. It's a nice pleasant environment and without doubt we'll be back again. The staff were absolutely fantastic and when they heard that it was my girlfriends birthday they pulled out all the stops and even gave us a complimentary birthday cake.

We drove in with our car at around 19.30, we were welcomed with a smile and with open arms, our car was parked by the staff and we proceeded to the Pavillon Restaurant for Dinner! What a welcoming Ambiance, staff, table decoration, a glass of house Champagne Philipponnat was served as a starter! Perfect and good service, excellent food... We were melting away and not forgetting the last surprise from the kitchen( a house made dessert to our wedding anniversary) lovely
This place is amazing, good food, good service, ideal garden view, variety of food is rich The place is unique and very sunny

The dining room is beautiful. It is round, and interestingly the acoustics allow for easy eavesdropping on conversations from the opposite side of the dining room. Unfortunately, the amuse-bouche was the best part of the meal, but it was spectacular. My wife's first course wwas stuffed morels. She didn't like it and asked for something else. The server appeared to be in disbelief. He asked us if we had had morels before. I was about to say "yesterday," but my wife was too polite for that. They did bring another dish, which was better.I had duck, which was reasonable but not at a Michelin star level. Also, I had to ask my server for a water refill. After that he was very attentive to the water. I guess it isn't his fault completely. The glass had purple strips, and it is hard to see how full it is without being directly above it.

This uber up scale restaurant offers Zurich outsiders a chance for a special treat - the restaurant's setting is right on the lake front adjoining a canal and the Hotel BAUR au Lac gardens, sets the tone.A few tables spread in a semicircle offer privacy and prepares the diner for a luxurious experience.Make sure you are prepared to pay... It's expensive even for Swiss standards!

Firstly the good- lovely charming dining room. Lots of room between the tables. Very attentive, friendly efficient service, although the sommelier was not concerned at all by my criticisms of the wine. Now for the not so good. We both had the tasting menu with one of us having the wine pairing. The bill including discretionary service was 500 Euros for which we would expect a memorable experience. The wine pairings were idiosyncratic, cheap,seemingly random wines without connection with the food. For example a dry acidic Riesling with the foie gras. A truly awful Sauvignon blanc with the mushrooms. A way too young alcoholic Spanish Ribera del Duero overpowered the veal. No sweet wine with the dessert. I reviewed the main wine list in detail before our visit and as a whole it contains a bunch of mediocre and overpriced wines. Hardly a single bottle of wine rated as above average by any wine critic. The sommelier suggested some extra glasses since I was not enjoying the flight, for which he charged extra at the end. Not good. The food was immaculately presented, looked great, very small portions but hey it's a tasting menu and we ate our way through 2 bread baskets to make up. However the food, while technically good, lacked any real passion or wow factor, little depth or intensity of flavour, no especially interesting or new flavours. The foie gras tasted like deli pate. The mushrooms with goat cheese sauce were bog standard mushrooms and the goats cheese sauce a bit pale, thin and acidic. The wild seabass was a nicely cooked square of the fish, crispy skin, no sauce. The veal was also presented in curiously similar square shapes, tender but not full of flavour and was accompanied by a thin crayfish sauce, underpowered. The cheese board was just the usual culprits, we had Comte and Roquefort all good deli stuff, nothing particularly interesting. The orange and chocolate dessert was actually pretty good. The bread basket was full of the usual bread culprits, sliced pieces of loaves you would find in any bakery. In summary, very disappointing at this price despite the very good service.

到每個城市,如果有機會,我們一定會挑選幾間米其林餐廳做為旅程的美好饗宴。這天我們選擇的是MENU HARMONIE with wine paring.從前菜、主餐到甜點以及每道料理選的餐酒都相當合宜。其中我們最喜愛脆皮鱸魚菲力佐墨魚汁和小牛肉里肌這兩道料理，羊肚菌也是相當少見的食材，Meursault Cuvée Maurice Chevalier, Remoissenet Père & Fils, Burgundy, France 2013 這支白酒選的相當好，美好怡人的香氣，和鱸魚排搭配的相得益彰，也是我們第一次嚐試甜點搭配柚子清酒。侍酒師以及服務人員專業到位，讓我們在用餐時刻相當愉快自得。

We dined here as we were staying at the hotel and very much enjoyed the evening. There was a private party in part of the dining room but that did not diminish the evening. Its a super location and layout. The staff were excellent. Knowledgable and very efficient. We would have scored it a 5 if the food was quite on a par with the prices but it just fell short in our opinion. Still very good

We enjoyed an excellent dinner on a rainy night in Zurich. We chose the 3-course tasting menu, which was preceded by two amuses bouches. For the main course, we both chose Swiss veal tenderloin, prepared in two different ways. The Swiss red wine recommended by the sommelier was a perfect pairing over multiple courses.

Cadre magnifiqueCarte à l'avenantService dans la tradition des grandes maisons françaisesSélection de vins époustouflante (Francais mais aussi Italiens, blancs Autrichiens, Suisses)Carte réduite mais de qualitéMenu 'Lunch' de saisonQue dire si ce n'est parfait et à bientôt

We had a table for 2 on a friday, waiting time for my wife was lovely bridged with a glass of wine and a look at the wine menu. We went for the "Harmony" menu with accompanying wines.Atmosphere was busy but still more than enough space between tables to be have privacy. We had two Amuse Gueule before we set off, first course was terrine from duck with green asperagus, second filled morells, third course sepia sauce with a delicious piece of line-caught turbot - the highlight of the evening, main was veal with very intense sauce, after a short break it was Yuzu icecream with hand made chocolate - a piece of art. Wines did match perfectly. All in all best dining experience in a while.Last time we went was 6 years ago and the experince was much better now than back then. Not cheap, so be prepared to part with some of your hardearned money, we had a gift voucher which eased the pain a bit.

Had my breakfast here for two days. The wait staff were polite and attentive. The eggs benedict were the best I have tried ever. The choice of cheese and cold cuts was limited though.Had dinner on the 2nd night. Not really familiar with fine dining style, I just partook whatever that has been ordered by the host. The 3-course meal was nice. Again the wait staff was fantastic and were patient enough to wait until our VIP guest called it a day almost mid night.

Il locale è molto bello,affacciato sul giardino dell'hotel.Bei tavoli ed apparecchiature di livello.Abbiamo optato per il menu degustazione Goa ( tre portate a scelta su un ventaglio di sei) con vini abbinati.In particolare il branzino su nero di seppia ed il parfait allo yuzu sono risultati eccellenti.Non mi hanno convinto invece le spugnole ripiene di pollo su crema di caprino( troppo asprigno il gusto del piatto).Vi è stata inoltre una disattenzione da parte di chi aveva raccolto le ordinazioni che solo grazie all'intervento del (bravo ) sommelier è stato evitato che mi venisse servito il vitello al posto del branzino. Ritengo anche migliorabile il cestino dei pani ( le cui tipologie andrebbero poi illustrate ai commensali) ed inoltre non considero elegante che alla donna venga consegnato il menu in cui compaiono i prezzi che,(data l'entità) potrebbero metterla in imbarazzo.Per tutti questi particolari non valuto di dare il massimo punteggio.

We enjoyed the harmonies menu with wine pairings. A few small issues take a star away from my review. There was confusion at time of seating, our reservation was confirmed with celiac requirements however wheat products were served in the first amuse bouche and we both ordered a sweet dessert and cheese however our waitress was confused so we ended up sharing one of each instead. The service minus these issues was great! Friendly and not pretentious. Food was flavourful and beautifully paired perfectly to wine.

Prior to Pavillon I`ve visited Messa, Clouds and some other good restaurants in Zurich, and this one is the Best. Food was delicious and place is really nice.not excellent due to:1. Coffee. Ordered an Espresso and receive something like Lungo - too big, too liquid.2. Service. As for me there was too much attention from the staff (they very friendly, of course). I just prefer to have a bit more freedom.

we went for a dinner with a friend of ours to the Pavillon again. as we have been disapointed last time for the parking service our expectations were high regarding the changes made. everything went smooth and we enjoyed the excellent service by all the staff. the food was very nice too.

The first time I have been there and need to say that the service is excellent. If you have kind of Business meetings, they might ask too much, if everything is fine and if something is missing. The food was good and tasty, also the amuse gueule was a nice side effect after the main course came to our table. What I am wondering is, I had bad stomach problems for nearly 30 minutes during I ate... Maybe germs in the kitchen? Might be, but I think as a conclusion it's nice to go there for the ambience and service, design but I wouldn't eat there again honestly.

One of the most beautiful and intimate restaurants in Zurich; convenient location with parking close by; a fantastic menue (well deserved accolades), great selection of fantastic wines (the excellent and tactful sommelier is always ready to make a great recommendation), and impeccable service.
Très belle endroit, cuisine raffinée, service élégant et souriant, vous pouvez y aller les yeux fermés. merci pour ce joli moment, nous avons passé une très belle soirée.

Wir wurden bei unserer Ankunft mit einem Upgrade in eine Junior-Suite überrascht.Nach einem Apero in der neu und sehr geschmackvoll dekorierten Hotellobby genossen wir ein wunderbares Menü im Restaurant Pavillon in intimem Rahmen und perfektem Service.Obwohl wir aufgrund der durchtanzten Nacht auf dem Opernball das Frühstück eher spät besuchten, konnten wir auch lange über die offizielle Frühstückszeit das opulente Buffet und den grossartigen Service im Restaurant Pavillon geniessen.
Exclusive restaurant, in a exclusive hotel and exclusive location in Zurich. The food was exquisite, and the service very professional and close at the same time.

visitando la citta capitiamo in questo ristorante dell albergo baur au lac.veniamo accolti dallo staff di sala pronto preparato e gentilissimo.la sala e molto bella luminosa moderna e elegante e vista molto caratteristica.prendiamo due menu degustazione ottimi .abbinamenti eccezionali e estetica dei piatti curatissimi.eccezionale il fois gras!dolci eccezionali.complimenti al sommelier che ci ha abbinato i vini al nostro menu.prezzo in linea con quello che abbiamo mangiato .bravi veramente!!!
We went their for valentines. We were surprised, great food and equally great wines to pair with the food they serve. nice ambience and excellent service. All top class. will be back

I'd been meaning to try this restaurant for some time and decided to try it out for Valentine's Day and I'm really glad I did - it was a superb meal with good wine and great service.We had a set 6 course menu with wine pairings and the highlight for me was the duck foie grois which was servers with a Swiss sweet wine which was surprisingly tasty.All of the food was presented so cleanly and it was aesthetically pleasing. I'm pleased to say that the food tasted as good as it looks. If you're looking for fine dining in Zurich then make sure Pavillon is on your list - you won't be disappointed.

Als Jahrzehnte langer Rive Gauche Gast des Baur au Lac in Zürich (hier sind wir sehr zufrieden mit der Qualität der Speisen), freuten wir uns wieder einmal ins Restaurant Le Pavillon zu gehen. Wir waren aber enorm enttäuscht. Nicht nur über die Qualität der Speisen (Magenkrämpfe in der Nacht), auch über die Grösse der Speisen und die Flexibilität beim Eingehen auf die Kundenwünsche.
